microSituations.title: I'm Lost
actions: Find nearest metro/tram station (look for M or T signs)
Use Moovit or Google Maps (works well)
Ask at info desk or police station
Look for major landmarks (Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar)
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Don't panic - Istanbul is walkable in old town. Use ferry for scenic routes.

microSituations.title: Public Transport
actions: Get Istanbulkart (‚Ç∫50 deposit) - works on metro/tram/ferry/bus
Tap card on reader before boarding
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Avoid taxis (negotiate first). Ferry is cheapest and most scenic.

microSituations.title: Taxi / Ferry
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Use ferry for scenic routes. Negotiate taxis before getting in.

microSituations.title: Quick Bite
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Don't eat at tourist trap restaurants. Walk 2 blocks away for better prices.

microSituations.title: Sit-Down Meal
actions: Point at menu if language barrier
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Eat lunch like locals (12-2pm) for best deals. Dinner after 7pm.

microSituations.title: Dietary Restrictions
actions: Tap water generally safe but bottled preferred
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Don't assume - always ask. Turkish restaurants are accommodating.

microSituations.title: 15-30 Minutes
actions: Visit a local caf√© for Turkish tea
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Don't rush. Istanbul is best experienced slowly.

microSituations.title: 1-2 Hours
actions: Hagia Sophia (book online, visit 9am to avoid crowds)
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Avoid peak times (10am-2pm). Early morning or late afternoon is better.

microSituations.title: Half Day
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Don't try to see everything. Pick one area and explore deeply.

microSituations.title: Safety Concern
actions: Istanbul is generally safe, but trust your instincts
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Istanbul is generally safe, but stay alert in tourist areas (scams).

microSituations.title: Scam / Suspicious
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Be polite but firm: 'Hayƒ±r te≈üekk√ºrler' (no thanks) and keep walking.

microSituations.title: Lost Item
actions: Report to embassy if passport stolen
Cancel cards immediately if wallet stolen
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Keep copies of passport/ID separate. Use hotel safe for valuables.

microSituations.title: Essential Phrases
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Don't worry - many Turks speak some English, but politeness matters.

microSituations.title: Ordering Food
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Don't be embarrassed. Pointing at menus is totally normal.

microSituations.title: Asking for Help
actions: Look for English signs (common in tourist areas)
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Turkish people are very helpful. Use translation apps if needed.

microSituations.title: Need Rest
actions: Find a local caf√© (Turkish tea ‚Ç∫5-10, sit as long as you want)
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Don't push through exhaustion. Rest is part of travel.

microSituations.title: Too Many Tourists
actions: Leave main areas: walk 10min away from Sultanahmet
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Tourist areas are crowded for a reason, but real Istanbul is 2 blocks away.

microSituations.title: Overwhelmed by Choices
actions: Pick one thing: food OR bazaars OR history
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Don't try to see everything. One great experience beats ten rushed ones.

microSituations.title: If you have 15 minutes
actions: Find a hidden street or alley
Discover a tiny street you've never heard of

microSituations.title: If you want something social
actions: Visit a market and chat with vendors
Attend a local event (check local listings)

microSituations.title: If it's raining
actions: Caf√© culture: sit inside with a book
